meanings.definition: To pass through a sieve in order to separate out particles or substances.
meanings.sent1: She sieved the flour to remove any lumps before baking the cake.
meanings.sent2: The chef always sieved the sauce to ensure it was smooth and creamy.
meanings.sent3: While making a sandcastle, Tim sieved the sand to find hidden seashells.
meanings.sent4: The detective sieved through the evidence to uncover the truth behind the crime.
meanings.sent5: The gardener sieved the soil to prepare it for planting seeds in the garden.

meanings.definition: Having been sifted through a sieve.
meanings.sent1: The baker used sieved flour to make the lightest and fluffiest pancakes.
meanings.sent2: The sieved sugar dissolved quickly in the hot tea, sweetening it perfectly.
meanings.sent3: The cat enjoyed the sieved litter in its box, finding it more comfortable to walk on.
meanings.sent4: The sieved sand on the beach felt soft and fine between our toes.
meanings.sent5: The sieved spices added a delicate flavor to the soup, making it delicious.
